subject: ibm: Start phosphor-fan-presence at multi-user
commitMessage:
ibm: Start phosphor-fan-presence at multi-user

This will start phosphor-fan-presence at the multi-user target.  It
doesn't need to know about the power state when just checking GPIOs and
tach sensors, so let it run all the time.  It also avoids a race
condition with phosphor-fan-monitor if it starts earlier.

This commit also adds a JSON vs YAML packageconfig so service files can
be installed to different places based on how it is configured.  And
since the service file has different contents based on when it starts,
the phosphor-fan-presence-tach@.service file was moved into the repo so
that the repo itself can determine which one to install based on how the
JSON vs YAML configuration option is set.

Signed-off-by: Matt Spinler <spinler@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I4c00f0854974c70efb5097d0344c45385dbcb085

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as ab79e2ad6e7dcd18a9663dfa0dca4cfef76bc13f by Brad Bishop
The direction has been to put the service files in the code repo vs. the meta layer. Any reason we can't do that here?
There's plans to move to meson soon.  It would save some work to just do that then.

> There's plans to move to meson soon.  It would save some work to just do that then.

looking forward to that!
Moving to the repo my also allow you to utilize the same service vs. needing two copies of it.
If this is started during power on, do we need to be sure it's running before any key events (like chassis power on or host start)?
No, nothing I can think of
This part confused me a bit. We've enabled the json PACKAGECONFIG feature above but we want to pass --disable-json-control to the build?

Yes, until the fan control app supports the use of JSON, it must explicitly be disabled so that the other fan apps (monitor & presence) can use JSON. The base `json` flag will eventually switch all fan apps to use JSON in place of YAML configs once fan control has been fully updated to support its config from JSON.
Comment doesn't really fit with next line anymore.
Ack
Done.

I know Brad has been pushing to get away from the SYSTEMD_LINK macro and just manually encode the logic like https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-openpower/recipes-phosphor/host/op-proc-control-systemd-links.bb but maybe that can be a refactor at some other point given this is just a simple add-on.
Yea, it would probably be safer to refactor when I'm not changing function at the same time.
